body: __This issue now has a funding of 0.01 ETH (3.23 USDT) attached to it.__  To view or claim this funding, [click here](https://gitcoin.co/funding/details?url=https://github.com/gitcoinco/ios/issues/1).
whoops meant to make this 0.1 ETH.  if anyone wants to tackle for that, im happy to send an extra tip.

I should be able to tackle this. After cloning this and running it I've noticed that after the launch screen it just goes to a white screen indefinitely. So I have a feeling there may be a few other bugs I need to fix to get it working right. Some duplicate definitions also appear to exist - Conflicting implementations of some items in VectorKit and MapKit. Haven't tracked any of this stuff down but I'll look into it.
word.  we might want to just throw away the old codebase and tackle issue #2 instead of trying to salvage teh current one.  would you have any interest in that?
Ya I can take a look at rebuilding it from the ground if you'd like. I'll move the conversation over to that issue.

In regards to my comments under issue #1 -- I've figured out why it wasn't loading any of those draggable views so I've got the app working again. Also, the duplicate definitions that I referenced appear to actually be a bug specific to Xcode 9.0.1 - so that issue wasn't worth digging into. After looking through the code I may just try to build on it instead of rewriting it to save some time for now. 

As far as email input goes - I'm wondering what your thoughts were. Are we looking to use OAuth and have them sign in to a GitHub account? Or did you actually just want them to punch in their email real quick and be done with it?

For entering skills - I'm trying to find a preexisting set of languages/tags that GitHub uses. I'm unsure if on the GitCoin site you are cross-referencing peoples skills with a master list of skills or if people just type text and hope it matches. Are you familiar with a pre-existing set of data with languages that I can use in the app to help them choose there skills from?

Also, I can't seem to determine what the bounty identifier is in the data that is returned. There are some data fields in the JSON array that look like they could be the ID but they are not labeled. How can I determine the unique id of a bounty when I grab them all?

@owocki - I'd definitely like your feedback on some of the above questions before I continue forward. I started a fresh rewrite of the repository over the weekend but would like your input on those things before continuing forward so that I can best address the vision for the app and so that we don't throw out what I take time to write. Thanks

im at ethereum devcon this week. can we sync up this weekend / early next week?  there are others interested in doing the work, so i def don't want you to get too ahead of yourself working on this before we have a chance to sync.

Ok. We can definitely sync up whenever. I'll stop development for now then. I've got a rewrite going in swift that added a table view for all the bounties so you can view them all in one place and was going to start writing in the ability to search by type, and sort based on fields and other things but I'll just wait to hear more info then so I don't end up throwing away a bunch of work.

@owocki Could you have api errors respond with a 500 status code and a json formatted response?

https://gitcoin.co/api/v0.1/bounties/?idx_status=open&order_by=-web3_created&pk__gt=

> @owocki Could you have api errors respond with a 500 status code and a json formatted response?

> Could we create a route like https://gitcoin.co/api/v0.1/profile/cheneveld/keywords???

just pushed up a fix for both of these
Looks like I'm missing something called 'Mapper'.  Does it need to be added to the podfile? http://bits.owocki.com/051m3M0G3i0N/Image%202017-11-09%20at%2011.12.15%20AM.png
No you probably opened the "Gitcoin.xcodeproj" file, need to open and use the workspace file "Gitcoin.xcworkspace"

> No you probably opened the "Gitcoin.xcodeproj" file, need to open and use the workspace file "Gitcoin.xcworkspace"


hmmm i seem to have a bunch more build issues when i do this => http://bits.owocki.com/3k3W0I2K2m0z/Screen%20Shot%202017-11-09%20at%201.13.32%20PM.png

it's not super urgent for me to get this working; maybe next time we get together we can pair on getting it working
k, what version of xcode are you on?
Version 9.1 (9B55)
Pull this latest and rerun pod install

I think we will need to convert from cocoapods to either Swift Package Manager or Carthage for our dependency management in the future.

I just got some weird behavior with pods.

after I commented out the pod dependencies in the [Podfile](https://github.com/cheneveld/ios/blob/master/Podfile#L10-L33), ran pod install, uncommented em, then pod install again it started working again.

@owocki perhaps do that if you still have problems.

I think long term is to move away from Cocoapods
it built!  i'm in, thanks!

@owocki I'm ready to pass the user skills/keywords to the [bounty api endpoint via raw_data](https://github.com/gitcoinco/ios/pull/3/commits/c36dbfb863acd9e34f1ebcce42cb3f92dd54cf8e#diff-416c854fa58ce60ef5ba98ea312f2bf6R100) but seems it only accepts a single string.  How can I pass multiple values?

> @owocki I'm ready to pass the user skills/keywords to the bounty api endpoint via raw_data but seems it only accepts a single string. How can I pass multiple values?

Just pushed support for `comma,delimited,keyword,values`.  Give it a try now!

heres a sample request from my local:

```
http://localhost:8080/api/v0.1/bounties/?&raw_data=owocki,piper&idx_status=open&network=mainnet&coinbase=0x4331b095bc38dc3bce0a269682b5ebaefa252929&order_by=-web3_created
```

note the `owocki,piper`
@owocki can we have another bounty description field that is plain text, removed html, for displaying simply on the bounty cards?

> @owocki can we have another bounty description field that is plain text, removed html, for displaying simply on the bounty cards?

sure, itll be called `issue_description_text`
deploying `issue_description_text` now

@owocki could you clean up the issue_description_text? I think just removing newlines at begining of text and removing when we have 3 or more turn to 2 -> https://screencast.com/t/vbUqdeOo5

Could even make max 1 new line as ios will(can) indent on each new line

> @owocki could you clean up the issue_description_text? I think just removing newlines at begining of text and removing when we have 3 or more turn to 2 -> https://screencast.com/t/vbUqdeOo5

sure thing, https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/commit/54e728adf341c6e83b1a8bff2b04115001ed9002 takes care of this
Any updates on this? I'd love to help out!
